keyword: calories in 1 lb 8020 ground beef cooked
title: Calories in 1 lb 80/20 Ground Beef Cooked
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 lb 8020 ground beef cooked, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks.
h1: Calories in 1 lb 80/20 Ground Beef Cooked
assumptions: 80/20 ground beef (80% lean, 20% fat), pan-browned and drained of excess fat; no added salt, seasonings, or binders; 1 lb raw yields ~12 oz cooked after fat loss.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, exact fat content, cooking method (e.g., drained vs. not), and portion yield; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 lb of cooked 80/20 ground beef provides ~1226 kcal and ~113 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Do not drain fat after cooking
Add 1 tbsp oil for cooking per lb

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 lb cooked 80/20 ground beef?
faqs.a: Approximately 1226 kcal, based on drained pan-browned preparation.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 1 lb 80/20 ground beef cooked?
faqs.a: About 113 g of protein, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in 80/20 ground beef?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”draining fat reduces calories; not draining or adding oil increases them.

faqs.q: How much fat is in 1 lb cooked 8020 ground beef?
faqs.a: Roughly 82 g total fat, including 32 g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Are carbs present in cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: Negligible carbs (0 g); it's primarily protein and fat.
